verses.name: Proverbs 18:1
verses.text: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:2
verses.text: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:3
verses.text: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:4
verses.text: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:5
verses.text: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:6
verses.text: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.
